channel.title: the following signatures were invalid: EXPKEYSIG 74A941BA219EC810 deb.torproject.org archive signing key
channel.description:
Is this related?
W: Failed to fetch http://deb.torproject.org/torproject.org/dists/stretch/InRelease The following signatures were invalid: EXPKEYSIG 74A941BA219EC810 deb.torproject.org archive signing key

item.title: the following signatures were invalid: EXPKEYSIG 74A941BA219EC810 deb.torproject.org archive signing key
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
github.com/QubesOS/qubes-issues

Issue: gpg fails in debian-9 based TemplateVM through Qubes UpdatesProxy - gpg: keyserver receive failed: No keyserver available

opened by adrelanos on 2018-09-09 
Qubes OS version:
R4
Affected component(s):
debian-9
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
Simplified gpg command for easier testing.
sudo http_proxy=http://127.0.0.1:8082/ gpg --keyserver hkp://ipv4.pool.sks-keyservers.net:80 --recv-keys 916B8D99C38EAF5E8ADC7A2A8D66066A2EEACCDA
The actual command...
C: templates bug

Read full topic

item.title: the following signatures were invalid: EXPKEYSIG 74A941BA219EC810 deb.torproject.org archive signing key
item.dc:creator: 0brand
item.description:
Patrick:

Qubes-Whonix fix:
Did it work to proxy through Qubes updates proxy? @0brand Could you add please?

Not sure what you are asking. A solutions was found for Qubes updates proxy? It thought we were still working on this.

Read full topic

item.title: the following signatures were invalid: EXPKEYSIG 74A941BA219EC810 deb.torproject.org archive signing key
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
LakeMonster:

I assume they use Qubes update proxy by default?

Yes but the gpg command will fail closed by default and making it work through updates proxy is non-trivial if you don’t know the command.

Read full topic

item.title: the following signatures were invalid: EXPKEYSIG 74A941BA219EC810 deb.torproject.org archive signing key
item.dc:creator: LakeMonster
item.description:
I only use Qubes-Whonix, and both my whonix templates are affected. I assume they use Qubes update proxy by default? In which case that doesn’t help my situation.

Thanks for fix. Installing package fixed it.

Read full topic
item.source: the following signatures were invalid: EXPKEYSIG 74A941BA219EC810 deb.torproject.org archive signing key

item.title: the following signatures were invalid: EXPKEYSIG 74A941BA219EC810 deb.torproject.org archive signing key
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
Non-Qubes-Whonix only fix:

sudo apt-key --keyring /etc/apt/trusted.gpg.d/torprojectarchive.gpg adv --keyserver hkp://ipv4.pool.sks-keyservers.net:80 --recv-keys A3C4F0F979CAA22CDBA8F512EE8CBC9E886DDD89

Qubes-Whonix fix:
Did it work to proxy through Qubes updates proxy? @0brand Could you add please?

Page https://www.whonix.org/wiki/Tor_Versioning was missing advice to install package deb.torproject.org-keyring which keeps the signing key updated. Just now added.

Read full topic
